definition: row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense

sentences.english: Small and portable, the iron cauldron was once used as a field cauldron, according to experts.
sentences.chinese: 據專家介紹鐵釜是一種行軍鍋，它體積小，便於攜帶。

sentences.english: John turned up for the ten-mile walk equipped for something more like an assault on Everest.
sentences.chinese: 約翰轉而開始了十英里的行軍，全副武裝。

sentences.english: This was the Bataan death march.
sentences.chinese: 這就是巴丹半島的死亡行軍。

sentences.english: The hungry marchers shambled slowly along the road.
sentences.chinese: 行軍的人餓得步履蹣跚在路上慢慢走着。

sentences.english: After a long day the range you relax by watching "Red Dawn".
sentences.chinese: 行軍一整天后，你看《赤色黎明》來放鬆。

sentences.english: On their long march, the King and his army made camp for the night wherever they could.
sentences.chinese: 在行軍途中，國王每晚都要依地紮營。

sentences.english: That wasn't a run it was a death march .
sentences.chinese: 這就是巴丹半島的死亡行軍。

sentences.english: Spain are used everywhere in place of the march, dance paso doble.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙的每一個地方都是用鬥牛舞代替行軍舞。

sentences.english: The Brazilian rainforests around the Manos is the place to come if you want to see Army Ants on the march.
sentences.chinese: 巴西曼諾斯附近的雨林是觀看兵蟻行軍的最佳地點。

sentences.english: He hurried on, lest he should drop out in the forced match.
sentences.chinese: 他加快步伐，生怕在急行軍中掉隊。

sentences.english: At night he would lie sleepless on his cot, suffering an almost unbearable frustration.
sentences.chinese: 晚上他躺在行軍牀上睡不着覺，灰心喪氣難熬難捱。

sentences.english: Your bivouac for the night is the spot where you got tired of marching that day.
sentences.chinese: 你夜間的宿營地是你白天行軍累了的處所。

sentences.english: Reconnoitre the soldiers marching speed limited.
sentences.chinese: 加強營戰士們行軍速度有限。

sentences.english: The derro make haste to their new settlement at a forced march.
sentences.chinese: 迪洛矮人向新定居點急行軍。

sentences.english: The soldier proportioned his pace to the march.
sentences.chinese: 戰士調製步子以便與行軍的步伐一致。

definition: Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
dauntless/to summon up courage and determination/using extreme force of will
to dispatch troops/to send an army/to mobilize forces
the Qin army (model for the terracotta warriors)
to go on a punitive expedition
to investigate a crime/to scout/to reconnoiter/reconnaissance/detection/a scout
